label: 資財帳
本: The Emergence of Japanese Kingship . Stanford University Press . 1997
説明文: an itemized report listing the holdings, treasures, and human dependents of an official temple, prepared for submission to royal authorities. Such eighth-century records from Hōryūji, Daianji, and Gangōji are still extant. Accounts of the temple's founding known as engi （縁起） were often attached. [法隆寺、大安寺、元興寺]
